trans-unit.source: Notification Hubs Breaking News Tutorial - iOS
trans-unit.target: Notification Hubs Breaking News Tutorial - iOS

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Azure Service Bus Notification Hubs to send breaking news notifications to iOS devices.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Azure Service Bus Notification Hubs to send breaking news notifications to iOS devices.

trans-unit.source: Use Notification Hubs to send breaking news
trans-unit.target: Use Notification Hubs to send breaking news

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to use Azure Notification Hubs to broadcast breaking news notifications to an iOS app.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to use Azure Notification Hubs to broadcast breaking news notifications to an iOS app.

trans-unit.source: When complete, you will be able to register for breaking news categories you are interested in, and receive only push notifications for those categories.
trans-unit.target: When complete, you will be able to register for breaking news categories you are interested in, and receive only push notifications for those categories.

trans-unit.source: This scenario is a common pattern for many apps where notifications have to be sent to groups of users that have previously declared interest in them, e.g. RSS reader, apps for music fans, etc.
trans-unit.target: This scenario is a common pattern for many apps where notifications have to be sent to groups of users that have previously declared interest in them, e.g. RSS reader, apps for music fans, etc.

trans-unit.source: Broadcast scenarios are enabled by including one or more tags when creating a registration in the notification hub.
trans-unit.target: Broadcast scenarios are enabled by including one or more tags when creating a registration in the notification hub.

trans-unit.source: When notifications are sent to a tag, all devices that have registered for the tag will receive the notification.
trans-unit.target: When notifications are sent to a tag, all devices that have registered for the tag will receive the notification.

trans-unit.source: Because tags are simply strings, they do not have to be provisioned in advance.
trans-unit.target: Because tags are simply strings, they do not have to be provisioned in advance.

trans-unit.source: For more information about tags, refer to [Notification Hubs Guidance].
trans-unit.target: For more information about tags, refer to [Notification Hubs Guidance].

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: This topic builds on the app you created in <link><linkText>Get started with Notification Hubs[get-started]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: This topic builds on the app you created in <link><linkText>Get started with Notification Hubs[get-started]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Before starting this tutorial, you must have already completed <link><linkText>Get started with Notification Hubs[get-started]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Before starting this tutorial, you must have already completed <link><linkText>Get started with Notification Hubs[get-started]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Add category selection to the app
trans-unit.target: Add category selection to the app

trans-unit.source: The first step is to add the UI elements to your existing storyboard that enable the user to select categories to register.
trans-unit.target: The first step is to add the UI elements to your existing storyboard that enable the user to select categories to register.

trans-unit.source: The categories selected by a user are stored on the device.
trans-unit.target: The categories selected by a user are stored on the device.

trans-unit.source: When the app starts, a device registration is created in your notification hub with the selected categories as tags.
trans-unit.target: When the app starts, a device registration is created in your notification hub with the selected categories as tags.

trans-unit.source: In your MainStoryboard_iPhone.storyboard add the following components from the object library:
trans-unit.target: In your MainStoryboard_iPhone.storyboard add the following components from the object library:

trans-unit.source: A label with "Breaking News" text,
trans-unit.target: A label with "Breaking News" text,

trans-unit.source: Labels with category texts "World", "Politics", "Business", "Technology", "Science", "Sports",
trans-unit.target: Labels with category texts "World", "Politics", "Business", "Technology", "Science", "Sports",

trans-unit.source: Six switches, one per category, set each switch State to be Off by default.
trans-unit.target: Six switches, one per category, set each switch State to be Off by default.

trans-unit.source: One button labeled "Subscribe"
trans-unit.target: One button labeled "Subscribe"

trans-unit.source: Your storyboard should look as follows:
trans-unit.target: Your storyboard should look as follows:

trans-unit.source: In the assistant editor, create outlets for all the switches and call them "WorldSwitch", "PoliticsSwitch", "BusinessSwitch", "TechnologySwitch", "ScienceSwitch", "SportsSwitch"
trans-unit.target: In the assistant editor, create outlets for all the switches and call them "WorldSwitch", "PoliticsSwitch", "BusinessSwitch", "TechnologySwitch", "ScienceSwitch", "SportsSwitch"

trans-unit.source: Create an Action for your button called "subscribe".
trans-unit.target: Create an Action for your button called "subscribe".

trans-unit.source: Your ViewController.h should contain the following:
trans-unit.target: Your ViewController.h should contain the following:

trans-unit.source: Create a new Cocoa Touch Class called Notifications.
trans-unit.target: Create a new Cocoa Touch Class called Notifications.

trans-unit.source: Copy the following code in the interface section of the file Notifications.h:
trans-unit.target: Copy the following code in the interface section of the file Notifications.h:

trans-unit.source: Add the following import directive to Notifications.m:
trans-unit.target: Add the following import directive to Notifications.m:

trans-unit.source: Copy the following code in the implementation section of the file Notifications.m and replace the and placeholders with your notification hub name and the connection string for DefaultListenSharedAccessSignature that you obtained earlier.
trans-unit.target: Copy the following code in the implementation section of the file Notifications.m and replace the and placeholders with your notification hub name and the connection string for DefaultListenSharedAccessSignature that you obtained earlier.

trans-unit.source: This class uses local storage to store and retrieve the categories of news that this device will receive.
trans-unit.target: This class uses local storage to store and retrieve the categories of news that this device will receive.

trans-unit.source: Also, it contains a method to register for these categories.
trans-unit.target: Also, it contains a method to register for these categories.

trans-unit.source: Because credentials that are distributed with a client app are not generally secure, you should only distribute the key for listen access with your client app.
trans-unit.target: Because credentials that are distributed with a client app are not generally secure, you should only distribute the key for listen access with your client app.

trans-unit.source: Listen access enables your app to register for notifications, but existing registrations cannot be modified and notifications cannot be sent.
trans-unit.target: Listen access enables your app to register for notifications, but existing registrations cannot be modified and notifications cannot be sent.

trans-unit.source: The full access key is used in a secured backend service for sending notifications and changing existing registrations.
trans-unit.target: The full access key is used in a secured backend service for sending notifications and changing existing registrations.

trans-unit.source: In the AppDelegate.h file, add an import statement for Notifications.h and add a property for an instance of the Notifications class:
trans-unit.target: In the AppDelegate.h file, add an import statement for Notifications.h and add a property for an instance of the Notifications class:

trans-unit.source: This creates a singleton instance of the Notification class in the AppDelegate.
trans-unit.target: This creates a singleton instance of the Notification class in the AppDelegate.

trans-unit.source: In the didFinishLaunchingWithOptions method in AppDelegate.m, add the code to initialize the notifications instance at the beginning of the method:
trans-unit.target: In the didFinishLaunchingWithOptions method in AppDelegate.m, add the code to initialize the notifications instance at the beginning of the method:

trans-unit.source: The initializes the Notification singleton.
trans-unit.target: The initializes the Notification singleton.

trans-unit.source: In the didRegisterForRemoteNotificationsWithDeviceToken method in AppDelegate.m, replace the code in the method with the following code to pass the device token to the notifications class.
trans-unit.target: In the didRegisterForRemoteNotificationsWithDeviceToken method in AppDelegate.m, replace the code in the method with the following code to pass the device token to the notifications class.

trans-unit.source: The notifications class will perform the registering for notifications with the categories.
trans-unit.target: The notifications class will perform the registering for notifications with the categories.

trans-unit.source: If the user changes category selections, we call the subscribeWithCategories method in response to the subscribe button to update them.
trans-unit.target: If the user changes category selections, we call the subscribeWithCategories method in response to the subscribe button to update them.

trans-unit.source: Because the device token assigned by the Apple Push Notification Service (APNS) can chance at any time, you should register for notifications frequently to avoid notification failures.
trans-unit.target: Because the device token assigned by the Apple Push Notification Service (APNS) can chance at any time, you should register for notifications frequently to avoid notification failures.

trans-unit.source: This example registers for notification every time that the app starts.
trans-unit.target: This example registers for notification every time that the app starts.

trans-unit.source: For apps that are run frequently, more than once a day, you can probably skip registration to preserve bandwidth if less than a day has passed since the previous registration.
trans-unit.target: For apps that are run frequently, more than once a day, you can probably skip registration to preserve bandwidth if less than a day has passed since the previous registration.

trans-unit.source: Note that at this point there should be no other code in the didRegisterForRemoteNotificationsWithDeviceToken method.
trans-unit.target: Note that at this point there should be no other code in the didRegisterForRemoteNotificationsWithDeviceToken method.

trans-unit.source: The following methods should already be present in AppDelegate.m from completing the <link><linkText>Get started with Notification Hubs[get-started]</linkText><title></title></link> tutorial.
trans-unit.target: The following methods should already be present in AppDelegate.m from completing the <link><linkText>Get started with Notification Hubs[get-started]</linkText><title></title></link> tutorial.

trans-unit.source: If not, add them.
trans-unit.target: If not, add them.

trans-unit.source: This method handles notifications received when the app is running by displaying a simple UIAlert.
trans-unit.target: This method handles notifications received when the app is running by displaying a simple UIAlert.

trans-unit.source: In ViewController.m, add a import statement for AppDelegate.h and copy the following code into the XCode-generated subscribe method.
trans-unit.target: In ViewController.m, add a import statement for AppDelegate.h and copy the following code into the XCode-generated subscribe method.

trans-unit.source: This code will update the notification registration to use the new category tags the user has chosen in the user interface.
trans-unit.target: This code will update the notification registration to use the new category tags the user has chosen in the user interface.

trans-unit.source: This method creates an NSMutableArray of categories and uses the Notifications class to store the list in the local storage and registers the corresponding tags with your notification hub.
trans-unit.target: This method creates an NSMutableArray of categories and uses the Notifications class to store the list in the local storage and registers the corresponding tags with your notification hub.

trans-unit.source: When categories are changed, the registration is recreated with the new categories.
trans-unit.target: When categories are changed, the registration is recreated with the new categories.

trans-unit.source: In ViewController.m, add the following code in the viewDidLoad method to set the user interface based on the previously saved categories.
trans-unit.target: In ViewController.m, add the following code in the viewDidLoad method to set the user interface based on the previously saved categories.

trans-unit.source: The app can now store a set of categories in the device local storage used to register with the notification hub whenever the app starts.
trans-unit.target: The app can now store a set of categories in the device local storage used to register with the notification hub whenever the app starts.

trans-unit.source: The user can change the selection of categories at runtime and click the subscribe method to update the registration for the device.
trans-unit.target: The user can change the selection of categories at runtime and click the subscribe method to update the registration for the device.

trans-unit.source: Next, you will update the app to send the breaking news notifications directly in the app itself.
trans-unit.target: Next, you will update the app to send the breaking news notifications directly in the app itself.

trans-unit.source: Send notifications
trans-unit.target: Send notifications

trans-unit.source: Normally notifications would be sent by a backend service but, for this tutorial we will update our send notification code so that we can send breaking news notifications directly from the app.
trans-unit.target: Normally notifications would be sent by a backend service but, for this tutorial we will update our send notification code so that we can send breaking news notifications directly from the app.

trans-unit.source: To do this we will update the SendNotificationRESTAPI method that we defined in the Get started with Notification Hubs[get-started] tutorial.
trans-unit.target: To do this we will update the SendNotificationRESTAPI method that we defined in the Get started with Notification Hubs[get-started] tutorial.

trans-unit.source: In ViewController.m update the SendNotificationRESTAPI method as follows so that it takes a Platform Notification Service pns parameter, and a parameter for the category tag.
trans-unit.target: In ViewController.m update the SendNotificationRESTAPI method as follows so that it takes a Platform Notification Service pns parameter, and a parameter for the category tag.

trans-unit.source: In ViewController.m update the Send Notification action as shown in the code that follows.
trans-unit.target: In ViewController.m update the Send Notification action as shown in the code that follows.

trans-unit.source: So that it will send the notifications using each tag individually and send to multiple platforms.
trans-unit.target: So that it will send the notifications using each tag individually and send to multiple platforms.

trans-unit.source: Rebuild your project and make sure you have no build errors.
trans-unit.target: Rebuild your project and make sure you have no build errors.

trans-unit.source: Run the app and generate notifications
trans-unit.target: Run the app and generate notifications

trans-unit.source: Press the Run button to build the project and start the app.
trans-unit.target: Press the Run button to build the project and start the app.

trans-unit.source: Select some breaking news options to subscribe to and then press the Subscribe button.
trans-unit.target: Select some breaking news options to subscribe to and then press the Subscribe button.

trans-unit.source: You should see a dialog indicating the notifications have been subscribed to.
trans-unit.target: You should see a dialog indicating the notifications have been subscribed to.

trans-unit.source: When you choose Subscribe, the app converts the selected categories into tags and requests a new device registration for the selected tags from the notification hub.
trans-unit.target: When you choose Subscribe, the app converts the selected categories into tags and requests a new device registration for the selected tags from the notification hub.

trans-unit.source: Enter a message to be sent as breaking news then press the Send Notification button
trans-unit.target: Enter a message to be sent as breaking news then press the Send Notification button

trans-unit.source: Each device subscribed to breaking news will receive the breaking news notifications you just sent.
trans-unit.target: Each device subscribed to breaking news will receive the breaking news notifications you just sent.

trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.target: In this tutorial we learned how to broadcast breaking news by category.

trans-unit.target: This is a good solution for sending notifications only to specific users.
